function.name: get_car_deals
function.description: Get car deals using filters with operator and value/min/max for each field.

cars.description: List of car filter groups (OR logic). Each group can contain make, model, trim, price, etc. Only include arguments that are explicitly mentioned or clearly implied by the user; do not add any unspecified fields.

make.description: Car manufacturer, e.g., BMW, Toyota, Ford.

model.description: Car model, e.g., M3, Camry, Mustang.

value.description: Exact price value to compare against (used with operator 'eq', 'lt', 'gt', etc.)

min.description: Minimum price value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

max.description: Maximum price value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

operator.description: Comparison operator. Use 'lt' for less than, 'gt' for greater than, 'eq' for exact match, 'not' to exclude, and 'between' to specify a price range.

value.description: Exact year to compare against (used with operator 'eq', 'lt', 'gt', etc.)

min.description: Minimum year value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

max.description: Maximum year value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

operator.description: Comparison operator. Use 'lt' for less than, 'gt' for greater than, 'eq' for exact match, 'not' to exclude, and 'between' to specify a year range.

value.description: Exact mileage value to compare against (used with operator 'eq', 'lt', 'gt', etc.)

min.description: Minimum mileage value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

max.description: Maximum mileage value for filtering a range. Used when 'operator' is 'between'.

operator.description: Comparison operator. Use 'lt' for less than, 'gt' for greater than, 'eq' for exact match, 'not' to exclude, and 'between' to specify a mileage range.

location.description: Filter based on ZIP codes. This allows including or excluding listings based on one or more ZIP/postal codes. DO NOT include states or sometnig like this in value field.

values.description: An array of ZIP code strings. Each string should represent a valid ZIP or postal code (e.g., '90210', '10001'). These will be used to include or exclude listings based on the specified operator.

operator.description:
The logic used to apply the ZIP code filter: 
- Use 'in' to include only the listings that are located in the provided ZIP codes. 
- Use 'not_in' to exclude listings from the provided ZIP codes.

epa_interior_volume_cu_ft.description: EPA interior volume in cubic feet filter.

cargo_capacity_cu_ft.description: Cargo capacity in cubic feet filter.

maximum_towing_capacity_lbs.description: Maximum towing capacity in pounds filter.

fuel_tank_capacity_gal.description: Fuel tank capacity in gallons filter.

epa_electricity_range_mi.description: EPA electricity range in miles filter.

exterior_color.description: Filter cars by exterior color. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['gray', 'white', 'black', 'blue', 'red', 'green', 'tan', 'orange', 'yellow', 'brown', 'purple', 'pink']. Accepts a list of possible colors.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified colors, 'not_in' to exclude specified colors.

transmission.description: Filter cars by transmission type. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['automatic', 'manual']. Accepts a list of transmission types. Common synonyms like 'stick shift' or 'standard' should be mapped to 'manual', and 'auto' to 'automatic'.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified transmission types, 'not_in' to exclude specified types.

drive_type.description: Filter cars by drive type. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['all wheel drive', 'front wheel drive', 'four wheel drive', 'rear wheel drive']. Accepts a list of drive types. Common synonyms like 'awd' should be mapped to 'all wheel drive', '4wd' to 'four wheel drive', etc.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified drive types, 'not_in' to exclude specified types.

cylinders.description: Filter cars by engine cylinder configuration. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['i4', 'v6', 'v8', 'flat 4', 'i6', 'i3', 'flat 6', 'i5', 'v12', 'v10', 'w12', 'i2', 'rotary 0', 'w16']. Accepts a list of cylinder types. Synonyms like 'inline 4' should be mapped to 'i4', 'v-eight' to 'v8', etc.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified cylinder types, 'not_in' to exclude specified types.

engine_type.description: Filter cars by engine type. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['gas', 'flex-fuel (ffv)', 'plug-in hybrid', 'mild hybrid', 'electric', 'hybrid', 'diesel', 'electric (fuel cell)', 'natural gas (cng)']. Accepts a list of possible engine types. Common synonyms like 'gasoline' or 'petrol' should be mapped to 'gas'.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified engine types, 'not_in' to exclude specified types.

country_of_origin.description: Filter cars by country of origin. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['united states', 'japan', 'germany', 'south korea', 'united kingdom', 'sweden', 'italy', 'france']. Accepts a list of countries. Common variants like 'usa', 'america', or 'uk' should be normalized accordingly.

values.description: List of accepted countries of origin.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified countries, 'not_in' to exclude specified countries.

body_type.description: Filter cars by body type. You must generalize user input to the closest match among: ['suv', 'sedan', 'truck', 'hatchback', 'van', 'coupe', 'convertible', 'wagon']. Accepts a list of possible body types. Common synonyms like 'sport utility' or 'pickup' should be mapped to 'suv' and 'truck' respectively.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match any of the specified body types, 'not_in' to exclude specified types.

certified.description: Filter by whether the car is certified (CPO - Certified Pre-Owned). Set to true if the user explicitly wants certified cars, or false if the user says they do not want certified cars.

value.description: Whether the user wants certified cars (true) or not (false).

operator.description: Use 'eq' to check for exact match of certified status.

safety_features.description: Filter cars by safety features. Accepts a list of safety features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

convenience.description: Filter cars by convenience features. Accepts a list of convenience features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

front_seats.description: Filter cars by front seat features. Accepts a list of front seat features that the car must have.

values.description: List of required front seat features.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

rear_seats.description: Filter cars by rear seat features. Accepts a list of rear seat features that the car must have.

enum: folding with storage and pass-thru center armrest
folds into floor third row seats
manual folding bench third row seats
manual folding split-bench third row seats
power folding bench third row seats
power folding split-bench third row seats
rear ventilation ducts with fan control

values.description: List of required rear seat features.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

suspension.description: Filter cars by suspension features. Accepts a list of suspension features that the car must have.

enum: short and long arm front suspension
short and long arm rear suspension

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

power_features.description: Filter cars by power features. Accepts a list of power features that the car must have.

enum: reverse tilt driver mirror provides curb view when vehicle in reverse
reverse tilt dual mirrors provides curb view when vehicle in reverse
reverse tilt passenger mirror provides curb view when vehicle in reverse
reverse tilt passenger only provides curb view when vehicle in reverse

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

comfort.description: Filter cars by comfort features. Accepts a list of comfort features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

entertainment.description: Filter cars by entertainment features. Accepts a list of entertainment features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

roof_and_glass.description: Filter cars by roof and glass features. Accepts a list of roof and glass features that the car must have.

enum: manual sunshades for rear side windows
power glass (tilt only) third row sunroof
power sunshades for rear side windows
speed sensitive and rain sensing wipers
swing out opening rear quarter windows

values.description: List of required roof and glass features.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

instrumentation.description: Filter cars by instrumentation features. Accepts a list of instrumentation features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

truck_features.description: Filter cars by truck-specific features. Accepts a list of truck features that the car must have.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

towing_and_hauling.description: Filter cars by towing and hauling features. Accepts a list of towing and hauling features that the car must have.

values.description: List of required towing and hauling features.

operator.description: Use 'in' to match cars with any of the specified features, 'all' to require all specified features, 'not_in' to exclude cars with any of the specified features.

sort.description: Sorting configuration for results. Only numeric fields can be sorted.

field.description: The field to sort by. Must be a numeric field.

direction.description: Sort direction. Use 'asc' for ascending (lowest to highest), 'desc' for descending (highest to lowest).

function.name: car_info
function.description: Use this function for simple car-related questions such as horsepower, acceleration, or top speed.

query.description: A natural language question about a car, e.g., 'How much horsepower does a BMW M3 have?'

function.name: evaluate
function.description: Use this function to evaluate car value, assess pricing, or answer questions about a vehicle's worth. It requires the car's make, model, year, and mileage. Optionally, the trim can be included if explicitly mentioned by the user. Do not infer or assume values for any missing fields.

make.description: Car manufacturer, e.g., BMW, Toyota, Ford.

model.description: Car model, e.g., Series 3, Camry, Mustang.

year.description: The production year of the car (e.g., 2020)

function.name: general_knowledge
function.description: Use this function to handle queries that are not specifically related to vehiclessuch as general knowledge, everyday questions, or casual conversation. It serves as a fallback for broad or open-ended topics outside the automotive domain

query.description: The original user query that is unrelated to vehicles.

function.name: car_comparison
function.description: Use this function for queries where 2 or more car models are being compared in any way.

cars.description: List of cars to compare. Each item should contain details such as make, model, year, and optionally trim.

make.description: Car manufacturer, e.g., BMW, Toyota, Ford.

model.description: Car model, e.g., Series 3, Camry, Mustang.

function.name: analyze_url
function.description: Use this function when the user provides a valid URL and expects an analysis, summarization, or specific information to be extracted from the linked content. This may include webpages, articles, product listings, or other online resources.

provided_link.description: The full URL to be analyzed. This should be a valid link to an online page or resource provided by the user.

query.description: A natural language question or instruction related to the content of the URL. For example, 'summarize this page', 'extract product price', or 'who is the author?'.
